title: Concatenating and Merging
content:
# Concatenating and Merging

You often need to combine datasets, like merging price data with fundamental data, or combining multiple stocks into one DataFrame.

## Concat
Stacking data on top of each other (adding rows) or side-by-side (adding columns).

```python
pd.concat([df1, df2], axis=1) # Combine columns (Side-by-side)
```

## Merge
Database-style joins (Inner, Outer, Left, Right). Useful for aligning data on timestamps.

```python
pd.merge(prices, earnings, on='Date', how='left')
```
code:
import pandas as pd

# Stock A
df_a = pd.DataFrame({'AAPL': [150, 152]}, index=[1, 2])
# Stock B
df_b = pd.DataFrame({'GOOG': [2800, 2820]}, index=[1, 2])

# Combine side-by-side
portfolio = pd.concat([df_a, df_b], axis=1)
print("Portfolio:")
print(portfolio)
